title: Remember how Riot likes to nerf champions who have very uninteractive laning phases?
body: How about we do that to Viktor.  After 1 back all he has to do is press E to instantly clear a wave lol.  All kill pressure you have on him is lost if he just sits in lane clearing waves the whole time and pushing you to your turret.  If you are able to somehow push back all he has to do is press E again and push it right back to you.  If you're melee then all he has to do is use his outplay mini orianna ult to stop you from doing anything lol.  If you're gonna let him keep his retarded waveclear at least make it cost some mana so he can't do it for all eternity.

replies.body:
The ridiculous part is that they *DID* that, they *DID* nerf his waveclear. Then they *gave it back to him* with a package of other changes that *viktor mains didn't like*. 

{{sticker:zombie-brand-mindblown}}

I dunno if this is 100% true or not, but everytime Riot reworks a champion, they either end up reverting nerfs that were supposed to keep them in check, or end up giving them so much power to other parts of their kits that the previous nerfs become irrelevant.

Honestly right after azir viktor is the 2nd most overloaded mage in the game: with long range poke, probably best waveclear in the game, amazing Aoe and zoning in fights, interrupt, amazing slows on spamable qs with rylais, movespeed on q, shield on q... 
It's no coincidence azir and viktor are like top tier picks in the lcs.

> amazing slows on spamable qs with rylais

He has a slow on rylais? Oh boy, no other mage has that...
To be fair few midlane mages get a targeted low cooldown spell that also speeds you up and give you a shield.
Few Midlaners also get a low cooldown spell that stacks AP if it hits a champion. Veigar must be broken...

We are talking about Rylai interaction here, not who has the best basic ability of midlane.

I hardly note anything relevant on your statement other that obvious misdirection.

I take it you don't play viktor? his E costs a pretty decent chunk of mana early on (70 at rank 1, and being it's typically maxed first, it'll be around 90 mana before first back), and certainly isn't spammable with the mana cost and 12 second cd. 
If he's pushing you into turret, he's overextended and shouldn't be that hard to gank early on.

Compare that to Morgana (W) and Lux (E) which are their waveclear abilities.  Also note that Morgana's W doesn't instaclear, and Lux's E isn't enough to one-shot the wave (even with passive), making it also take longer than Viktor's E.
Worth noting Morgana's also gives her sustain and Lux's leaves debuffed minions that are easy to last hit and works way better as poke.
Viktor also has a personal item that gives Mana per level.
Lol the guy didnt even both reading, AFTER one back either. which is when he becomes broken as fuck.

A lot of mages take multiple spells to clear a wave while Viktor takes only 1.

Taking level 9 max rank ability for a couple mages:

Brand: 180 mana
Orianna: 130 mana
Xerath: 200 mana
Ziggs: 150 mana
Viktor: 110 mana

The only person that comes even close to Viktor is Ori but she still has to auto attack minions before she can clear the wave.  All of the other champions listed take a lot more mana to clear a wave than Viktor and require two spells to do so.  Even then Viktor still has waveclear on par and even better compared to champions that take two abilities to do it.

Anyone with half a brain can get 1250 gold before their first back especially when you're playing a champion with braindead waveclear that is also a massive early game bully.  I play a champion with one of the worse pre 6s in the game and I can still manage to get over 1k gold for my first back.

Yes but it means he can't buy boots which means that pushing out waves doesn't let him roam as much.  Also keep in mind you are playing one of the few champs that can't force him to back before 1250 gold.  That is just part of Akali, you never will be able to stop ranged champs from getting their initial items.  It is a sacrifice you choose to make.

I wasn't talking about Akali vs Viktor specifically.  I'm talking about the fact that even playing as a champion that can get easily bullied in most matchups I'm still able to get 1k+ gold for my first back so adding an extra 250 gold to his upgrade won't do anything because he can still easily obtain it especially as an early game bully that is easy to farm with.  Sure it makes it so he has less money to spend on other items but that doesn't change the fact that he makes it almost impossible to interact with him after his first back.

I don't care if he can roam or not I just want to be able to actually interact with him instead of being pushed to my turret for the entirety of the laning phase without getting a chance to retaliate.  It's just dumb and not fun to play against.
You can't interact with VK after level 3, and yet he's not broken.

Viktor suffers from the same problems as Azir, Lee and Rekt'sai. They all scale really hard with skill and team co-ordination. That makes balancing him very difficult, because Riot are torn between balancing him for LCS and everybody else. I suspect they will nerf him because of his dominance in LCS. Personally, I'd go for his burst damage and consistency rather than his wave clear.

But you judging from your name, I'm not expecting much.

Id happily exchange his ability to full clear waves so early to get back his ability to instantly nuke squishies with his E/ult, like he used to be able to. It was always fun utterly annihilating the enemy back line with 2-3 spells like in the good old days. At least now his ability to dumpster people is delayed and has counter play(early/mid, anyway), such that in order to really reach his full potential he needs a good team to work with. 

The reason he is so popular in the LCS is more because of his ridiculous damage potential more than his wave clear. Viktor almost always has the most damage to champions by a large margin in games that he's in, as far as ive seen anyway.

But Viktor has always has insane wave clear for as long as I can remember, and even when they nerfed his E damage prior to the mid season mage update, he was still eventually able to full clear a wave with one E, it just took him slightly longer to do it. Again though, this was when all of his damage was up front and he could literally obliterate a squishy target in the blink of an eye.

It is annoying, sure, but I don't think its all that overpowered, and his early game is actually fairly weak compared to some other mid lane mages at the moment.

Cant we all just get along and focus on hating that avian hellspawn Azir instead? {{sticker:slayer-jinx-wink}}
Viktor's waveclear was continuous good.
